intro: Vincetoxicum chiapense, commonly known as Chiapas false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom in clusters. Vincetoxicum chiapense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
